abstracts.cdata!:
The HIV/AIDS, Malaria, and Tuberculosis
            Control Project aims at reducing the spread of HIV/AIDS
            among the Angolan population, through a multi-sector
            approach that strengthens institutional capacity, and
            increases access and use of quality health services for
            health prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and supportive
            care. To this effect, this Environmental Assessment (EA)
            will help identify, assess, and mitigate potential
            environmental and social impacts of project activities,
            including medical wastes. Impacts and control measures for
            health care centers include: Provision of containers, and
            protective equipment, and, training for workers to minimize
            exposure to hazardous waste. A wide awareness program shall
            be conducted on risks and impacts of hazardous health care
            waste, to include storage of wastes in containers, and its
            transportation to municipal disposal sites, following a
            careful site selection. This should reduce infection
            spreading, odors, smoke and air pollutants from open
            burning, and visual impacts. Adequate covering, drainage
            control, and run-off management should be ensured at storage
            areas so as to reduce surface, and ground water
            contamination. An ecological assessment of disease carriers
            should be conducted at areas planned for facility
            construction or rehabilitation, followed by identified
            mitigation measures. Such mitigation for rural water supply
            and sanitation include water conservation, appropriate sites
            location to avoid land use conflicts, and ensuring as well
            sufficient community participation. To minimize
            contamination and disease, planning of, and training in
            drainage monitoring, shall be established, as will adequate
            installation of latrines, and septic systems. Erosion
            control should be practiced to avoid damage to fragile
            ecosystems, natural sites and wilderness areas, as well as
            areas with significant biodiversity.
